1.text: At this also my heart trembleth, and is moved out of its place.

2.text: Hear attentively the noise of his voice, and the sound that goeth out of his mouth.

3.text: He directeth it under the whole heaven, and his lightning to the ends of the earth.

4.text: After it a voice roareth: he thundereth with the voice of his excellence; and he will not stay them when his voice is heard.

5.text: God thundereth marvelously with his voice; great things he doeth, which we cannot comprehend.

6.text: For he saith to the snow, Be thou on the earth; likewise to the small rain, and to the great rain of his strength.

7.text: He sealeth up the hand of every man; that all men may know his work.

8.text: Then the beasts go into dens, and remain in their places.

9.text: From the south cometh the whirlwind: and cold from the north.

10.text: By the breath of God frost is given: and the breadth of the waters is straitened.

11.text: Also by watering he wearieth the thick cloud: he scattereth his bright cloud:

12.text: And it is turned around by his counsels: that they may do whatever he commandeth them upon the face of the world on the earth.

13.text: He causeth it to come, whether for correction, or for his land, or for mercy.

14.text: Hearken to this, O Job: stand still, and consider the wondrous works of God.

15.text: Dost thou know when God disposed them, and caused the light of his cloud to shine?

16.text: Dost thou know the balancings of the clouds, the wondrous works of him who is perfect in knowledge?

17.text: How thy garments are warm, when he quieteth the earth by the south wind?

18.text: Hast thou with him spread out the sky which is strong, and as a molten looking-glass?

19.text: Teach us what we shall say to him; for we cannot order our speech by reason of darkness.

20.text: Shall it be told him that I speak? If a man shall speak, surely he will be swallowed up.

21.text: And now men see not the bright light which is in the clouds: but the wind passeth, and cleanseth them.

22.text: Fair weather cometh from the north: with God is terrible majesty.

23.text: Touching the Almighty, we cannot find him out: he is excellent in power, and in judgment, and in abundance of justice: he will not afflict.

24.text: Men therefore fear him: he respecteth not any that are wise of heart.
